name: Mercury
description: The smallest and fastest planet in the Solar System.
funFact: Mercury has almost no atmosphere, so temperatures vary wildly between day and night.

name: Venus
description: A planet with extreme temperatures and thick clouds.
funFact: Venus rotates backward compared to most planets, meaning the Sun rises in the west.

name: Earth
description: The only known planet to support life.
funFact: Earth is the only planet with liquid water on its surface and a breathable atmosphere.

name: Mars
description: Known as the Red Planet.
funFact: Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system, Olympus Mons.

name: Jupiter
description: The largest planet in the Solar System.
funFact: Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a storm larger than Earth and has been raging for centuries.

name: Saturn
description: Famous for its stunning ring system.
funFact: Saturn's rings are made mostly of ice and rock and extend thousands of kilometers.

name: Uranus
description: An ice giant that rotates on its side.
funFact: Uranus' axis is tilted over 90 degrees, making it appear to roll along its orbit.

name: Neptune
description: The windiest planet in the Solar System.
funFact: Neptune can produce winds exceeding 2,000 km/h, faster than the speed of sound on Earth.

name: Pluto
description: A dwarf planet located in the Kuiper Belt.
funFact: Pluto has a heart-shaped glacier known as Tombaugh Regio.

name: Ceres
description: The largest object in the asteroid belt.
funFact: Ceres may have a subsurface ocean and shows signs of water vapor.

name: Eris
description: A distant dwarf planet larger than Pluto.
funFact: Eris has one known moon called Dysnomia and takes 557 years to orbit the Sun.

name: Haumea
description: A fast-spinning dwarf planet with an elongated shape.
funFact: Haumea rotates so fast that it is stretched into an ellipsoid shape.

name: Makemake
description: A bright dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt.
funFact: Makemake has no atmosphere, making its surface extremely cold.

name: Io
description: The most volcanically active body in the Solar System.
funFact: Io has over 400 active volcanoes, some erupting lava hundreds of kilometers high.

name: Europa
description: An icy moon with a possible subsurface ocean.
funFact: Europa may have more water beneath its ice than all Earth's oceans combined.

name: Ganymede
description: The largest moon in the Solar System.
funFact: Ganymede has its own magnetic field, unique among moons in the Solar System.

name: Titan
description: A moon with lakes of liquid methane.
funFact: Titan is larger than Mercury and has lakes of liquid methane on its surface.

name: Triton
description: A moon with geysers of nitrogen ice.
funFact: Triton orbits Neptune backward, suggesting it was captured by the planet.

name: Enceladus
description: An icy moon that ejects water vapor into space.
funFact: Enceladus has geysers that shoot water vapor hundreds of kilometers into space.

name: Callisto
description: A heavily cratered moon of Jupiter.
funFact: Callisto is one of the oldest landscapes in the Solar System.

name: Charon
description: The largest moon of Pluto.
funFact: Charon has canyons that are up to 7-9 km deep.

name: Vesta
description: One of the largest asteroids in the Solar System.
funFact: Vesta has a giant crater called Rheasilvia nearly 500 km wide.

name: Kepler-22b
description: One of the first known exoplanets located in a habitable zone.
funFact: Kepler-22b might have liquid water and Earth-like temperatures.

name: Kepler-452b
description: Often called Earth's cousin due to its size and orbit.
funFact: Kepler-452b is considered the most Earth-like exoplanet discovered so far.

name: Proxima Centauri b
description: The closest known exoplanet to the Solar System.
funFact: Proxima b orbits within the habitable zone of its star, Proxima Centauri.

name: TRAPPIST-1e
description: A rocky exoplanet with potential for liquid water.
funFact: TRAPPIST-1e may have a rocky surface with oceans under the atmosphere.

name: HD 189733 b
description: A gas giant known for its extreme blue color and glass rain.
funFact: HD 189733 b has glass rain due to high-speed silicate particles in its atmosphere.

name: WASP-12b
description: An ultra-hot gas giant being slowly destroyed by its star.
funFact: WASP-12b is being pulled apart by its star's gravity, creating a comet-like tail.
